selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional
Class Mixture

java.lang.Object
  selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.AbstractConditionalDistribution
      selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.Mixture
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConditionalDistribution
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConditionalTable, GaussianMix, LinearGaussianMix, MultinomialSigmoidMix
public abstract class Mixture
extends AbstractConditionalDistribution

This handles a generalized mixture of discrete and continuous components

Author:
Charles Robertson

This grabs a matrix that specifies the sufficient variables that need to be set in order to specify the distribution completely. We should be able to use this to describe the distribution in an xml file, or as a part of the front end.

marginalize

public ConditionalDistribution marginalize(int index,
                                           boolean onDependencies)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
Marginalizes out one dimension. If index is < numDiscreteDimensions, it marginalizes out that discrete dimension at index, otherwise it marginalizes out numContinuousDimensions - index dimension in the continuous domain.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

extend

public int extend(int i)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
This extends the distribution by 1 dimension. If numStates <= 0, then it extends it in a continuous direction, otherwise it extends it in the discrete domain by adding a dimension with numStates states

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem extending the distribution
